dialogues.text: The Gang is taken aback by this blatant contradiction. Th a smile spreads across Clell's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody paid me no thousand dollars to fight in the War!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang LAUGHS, and the tension is broken. Jesse and Col slap each other's shoulders, and everyone starts counting their money and talking all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowded saloon is alive with music, card-playing, and dancing girls. Various James Gang members are playing car and drinking. Jesse, Cole, and Frank are at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better. It's a construction depot. They'll have the strongbox and some ammo and explosives for us to take. That way we can take on a bigger job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's guarded by Pinkerton detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I do so want to shoot some Pinkerton detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Cole grin and slap each other on the back. Jim BURSTS in waving a newspaper. He quickly runs to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stage whispering) We're famous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse takes the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Gang members drift over to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "The Fidelity Bank and Trust was robbed on Tuesday by a gang of twenty heavily armed men."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the odds, another gang robbing the same place right after we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Loni, that's exactly what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The outlaws calling themselves the James-Younger Gang shot their way out of town, wounding the Sherriff and three other townsfolk."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bank officials estimate the loss at fifty thousand dollars."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only got ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This happens all the time when you let the white man count the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The U.S. District Marshal at St. Louis called this the first daylight bank robbery in American history."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim whistles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made history. That's something to be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of this is all lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That just means the next time, we'll have to set the record straight ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half finished railroad tracks run alongside a few sheds a an office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRAIN TRACKS as the James-Younger Gang rides at full gallop. A rapid series of SEQUENTIAL EXPLOSIONS follows them, destroying the track for hundreds of yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire work camp is DESTROYED. SMOKE still hangs over the twisted wreckage, a few wagons smolder, it looks like Omaha Beach at D-DAY plus 20.  Thaddeus Rains is surveyin the damage with Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchanged fire with the Pinkerton Guards, killing several of them. Then they raided the payroll office and blew the tracks for half a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did they get from the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five thousand, sir. Coins and currency. And the delay from the miles of destroyed track --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill them for blowing up my railway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be precise, they didn't blow up the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEN WHO DID?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains stares at him. Parker swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I mean, our men. Our own workers planted the dynamite. (beat) They were under duress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains controls his cerebral hemorrhage through sheer forc of will. He checks his pocket watch, then says through gritted teeth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Pinkerton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF HORSES makes them turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fancy carriage that pulls up. WE SEE the ground beneath the carriage. A boot hits the ground. Then another. Then tip of a cane. REVEAL Alan Pinkerton now moving toward Rains and Parker, limping from when Jesse's horse trampled him. He has a newspaper folded up under one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, Pinkerton! They got the payroll, and this damage will set construction back two months at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveying) Not to mention my men who lost their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your men knew the risks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on here, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My professional opinion is that you have managed to piss off the wrong bunch of farm boys this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had to be dealt with!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By burning down their homes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have done that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I would have done that. But I would have made sure I killed them, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want them arrested and hanged!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would a jury around here convict their own? I think not. We're beginning an interesting game here, Mr. Rains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid our adversaries don't agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Rains the paper. Rains' eyes bug out. He begins read aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "A Rock Island and Pacific Railroad depot was robbed two nights ago just outside St. Louis, Missouri. The brave and daring James-Younger Gang was heavily outnumbered by Pinkerton detectives, but the city lawmen were no match for the guns of the West."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a nice piece of writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The gang made off with thirty-five thousand dollars and also destroyed the Thaxton Switch construction, meaning that for a few months honest farmers will be able to sleep without fearing the railroad is coming to steal their land!" (he slams the paper into Parker's chest) Who wrote this!? I'll see him hanged every Tuesday for a month!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's the best part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points Rains to the bottom of the article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The foregoing article was sent to the newspaper. It was reputedly written by the outlaw -- (exploding) Jesse James himself!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains crushes the paper in his hands, raging as he survey his destroyed rail tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc Mimms is reading a paper to Zee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...written by the outlaw Jesse James himself."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee is pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks this is some kind of game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm upset too, Zee, but Jesse and Cole know what they're doing. I'm sure they won't press their luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee looks at him. Doc Mimms sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But the Lord protects madmen and prophets, and Jesse's...one of them. I'm just not sure which.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freight train is coming. We can see "Rock Island and Pacific Railroad" written across the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGINEER nudges the fireman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, along the railbed, members of the James Gang are holding a series of signs, each one a dozen yards after t other. The engineer reads each one as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "Better... slow... down... dynamite... ahead... too late... you're dead!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engineer and the fireman look up. Ahead of them on th track is an overloaded wagon with barrels marked "TNT". The engineer slams on the brakes. The high pitched scream of steel on steel sounds out over the avalanche of sparks flying from the wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train stops juuuuust in time. The front of the engine is inches away from the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sticks his head in, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a fine piece of driving, yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the wagon. The engineer and fireman follow hi gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comanche Tom and Jim Younger climb on top of the wagon, kick over some barrels. They're empty, without even a top bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse grins as the engineer and fireman hang their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Frank walk into a large bank dressed in suits. Just inside the door, Frank notices something odd and nudges Jesse. It's a "Wanted" poster. "Frank and Jesse James. $5,000 reward." They look back and forth at the artist's sketches and eac other. They shake their heads "no." Jesse walks over to the teller's window. He hands a bill the TELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you change this please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying it) Sir, this bill is counterfeit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse draws. Frank whistles and Cole, Bob and Jim burst i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's counterfeit. Do you mind if I take a look at all your real bills to compare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the scientific method. It's all the rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN a richly paneled conference room, a group of BANKERS, POLITICIANS and RAILROAD OFFICIALS are gathered around a large table. On the table is a map with a dozen red marke Thaddeus Rains and Alan Pinkerton are studying the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, can't you do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Missouri SENATOR shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people see the James-Younger Gang as heroes against the Eastern businessmen. This is not an area where men in suits are much loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton, why can't you get these outlaws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's early in the game yet, Mr. Rains. Jesse James and I are just learning how each other moves, feeling out each other's patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm losing millions of dollars and months of time while you play chess with these farmers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly farmers. I've done some checking. All these were in the War. These men know sabotage, tactics, and have four years of bloody fighting experience behind them. They are disciplined, well-trained and have a charismatic leader. If I were to design the perfect outlaw band, this gang is what I would create.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can't tell me anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a long winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains pounds the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE GANG On horseback, firing back at a posse.

dialogues.speaker: -- THE GANG RIDES THROUGH A FIELD
dialogues.text: Where dozens of sharecroppers are sweating away. They lea a wake of twenty dollar gold certificates fluttering in t furrows and hanging in the corn.

dialogues.speaker: -- PINKERTON, LEADING TWENTY DETECTIVES,
dialogues.text: RIDING HARD up to a crossroad. With a wave of his hand, never stopping, he splits one group off to head East, and and the others head West.

dialogues.speaker: WALL OF "WANTED" POSTERS
dialogues.text: Marked the "James-Younger Gang." The James brothers and Younger brothers nod at the likenesses, which are getting better. All except Bob, who stares at his in disbelief. I looks nothing like him. Jesse tears down his poster and autographs it for a young boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang is riding hard. Cole and Jesse look over their shoulders, nod to each other, and WHISTLE. The men bring their horses down to an easy pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought that posse was gonna give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were admirably persistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, we got to have a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the posters and newspapers are calling this bunch the "James-Younger Gang."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't we the "Younger-James Gang"? I mean, there's three Younger brothers and only two James brothers here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda like the sound of the James-Younger Gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bristling) Whose side you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jimmy has a point. The Younger-James Gang could be confusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say we bust into a bank. We yell "We're the Younger-James Gang!" People are gonna be thinking, "The younger James Gang? Is there an older James Gang? How come we never heard of the older James gang?" So people are trying to figure that out instead of raising their arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't argue with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you boys are missing the point here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to argue as they ride off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about "James-Younger" for the bank jobs and "Younger-James" for the train robberies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's even more confusing, people'll think there's two gangs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comanche Tom RIDES UP to the building marked Marshall's Office. A MARSHALL and a dozen PINKERTON DETECTIVES are sitting around the porch. Tom leaps off his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 'um big lawman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Injun. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Chief of St. Louis send me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The District Marshall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of St. Louis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-yah. Him say tell Big Lawman in Carville that badman Jesse James riding toward Rising Sun, above Great River, near Eagle Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East? East above the river heading for the Eagle Pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-yah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshall turns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want every man in town! We can cut off Jesse James before he crosses out of my territory! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse quickly mounts up. The Marshall tosses Comanche Tom a coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead to the saloon. But don't get too drunk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me get heap firewater --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse RIDES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you cretins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comanche Tom flips the coin over his shoulder. From aroun the corner THUNDERS the James Gang. They ride up to the building marked "Bank" right next to the Marshall's offic The Gang dismounts, runs in. An improbably short time later, the Gang members run back out with full saddlebags and mount up. Comanche Tom RIDES OFF with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice performance, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same men in suits and the same map, only now with mor red markers on it.  In the center of the group are Thadde Rains, Rollin Parker and Alan Pinkerton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton. It's been eight months. I see robberies. I see hold ups. But I do not see men on the end of nooses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the James Gang's encounters have been with local law enforcement who, quite frankly, are no match for this group's cunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your detectives? They haven't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton suddenly CLOSES on Rains and Parker. Rains doesn't back down, but we are acutely aware of the fact t Alan Pinkerton is a big, violent Scotsman. He never raise his voice here, but then again -- he doesn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parker) First of all: you, shut up. (to Rains) Now, you've given me a thousand miles of railroad to cover. Every time the James Gang strikes, we shift a hundred detectives to that area. But there's just too much open land, too many riverbeds to ride, caves to hide in. This gang operates across four states, often riding a hundred miles between jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there are some towns in Missouri where James and his men can walk openly, as heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They donate money to farmers, to churches. Rumor has it they gave the sharecroppers of Maddox so much money they were able to build a school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go burn that school to the ground, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Yes, that's the way to win the locals back to our side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you demand results. They are not the same thing. And if you want results, you will let me do my job as I see fit. Unless of course, (jerking his head at Parker) You want this fool to saddle up and take another run at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you tell me anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a long spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE GANG RIDES ALONGSIDE A PAYROLL COACH, The COACH is marked with the "Rock Northern Railroad" logo. Suddenly Pinkerton guards leap up from hiding places in t coach and start firing! The gang fires back dropping two the men.

dialogues.speaker: BANK WINDOW
dialogues.text: Old "Wanted" posters are replaced by a new set.

dialogues.speaker: THE COACH IS STOPPED
dialogues.text: Jesse and Frank are pulling the payroll off as the rest o the Gang keeps their guns on the remaining Pinkertons. Tw dead Pinkertons lie on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's a shame. If people would just hand over the money and not shoot at us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loni looks at something in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky Rabbit's foot. Took it off that dead fella over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that one's working, Loni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loni pockets the charm. -- JESSE, FRANK, AND THE YOUNGER BROTHERS Sit heads bowed in a small country church as the collection plate is pass Jesse drops in a handful of twenty dollar gold pieces.

dialogues.speaker: -- A GROUP OF BOYS SWARM AROUND JESSE,
dialogues.text: Getting him to autograph his "WANTED! $10,000 REWARD DEAD OR ALIVE!" Poster. The Gang is all there, admiring the ne posters. The likenesses are remarkable -- except for Bob' It still looks nothing like him. And we can see Cole is n pleased at all the attention Jesse's getting.

dialogues.speaker: -- PINKERTON IN THE BOARD ROOM WITH HIS MAP,
dialogues.text: Directing his lieutenants on how to cover the territory. -- THE GANG CAROUSING IN A SALOON. Jesse is off to one side, writing a letter on fancy stationery. Frank is coaching him.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MIMMS HOME,
dialogues.text: Doc Mimms hands Zee the envelope we just saw Jesse workin with. Zee takes the envelope and tosses it into the burni fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, Cole, Frank, and Bob are in the middle of a stick-up. All the BANK PATRONS have their hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, folks, I think we know how this is going to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One false move and I'll blow your heads off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, Frank, and Cole look at Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, Jesse. You know how crazy I get!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Cole turn to the HEAD TELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think nothing of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Cole cross to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a problem here, brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Frankly, yes. I'm feeling a little left out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) This is about the "Wanted!" Posters, isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am obviously not standing out in people's minds at the robberies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) This is your fault for hogging all the publicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, hold on, we all know Bob is an important part of the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gents, we are in the middle of something here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say "yeah" in that voice. This is important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Jesse, and Cole exchange looks. They turn back to the now puzzled crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon the delay, folks, but we had to get Mad Bob Younger under control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob here'll kill a man for sneezing, and he's the best shot in the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than you, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Younger taught me how to shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd MURMURS APPRECIATIVELY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we would like to get back to the robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Head Teller starts filling a saddlebag with money. Bo glares at a few people, then nods at Jesse. Jesse winks b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is alive with song, gambling, and the money the James Gang is dropping. At one table, Loni Packwood lays down his poker hand. As the other players moan, he rakes the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Loni, you're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckiest man in the West, now that I'm riding with Jesse James!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his lucky rabbit's foot in toast to Jesse, who at the bar nursing a bottle of whisky with Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Frank at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been a good year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, we're outlaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got to you, didn't it. All the killing in the war. You need it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've killed your fair share of men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could go back to farming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie. You could've bought a dozen farms with the money we've stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't quit and leave you alone. I can't quit until you quit. Ma would've wanted it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing this for Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it started out that way. But now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say, Frank? I was killing men when I was fifteen. I like getting shot at. I like riding out of town with a posse at my back. This is a helluva better life than farming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A better life than the one you could have had with Zee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse HURLS the whisky bottle against the wall. At the CRASH the saloon falls silent. Every eye turns to the Jam boys. Frank stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you every dollar we've stolen that she hasn't read a single one of the letters you've sent her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is boiling. His hand twitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to throw down on me, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's jaw is grinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this, Frank. You know I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods, embraces his brother. The saloon noise STARTS UP again. Frank steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do me a favor. Think about what this is costing everybody. Not just the railroad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse nods and Frank EXITS. Jim Younger, also drunk, step up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hey, are you drinking whisky? You're too young to be drinking whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too young to shoot a man, not to young to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jolted) I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was always jealous Web Mimms got to go off and fight with you and Cole. Now it's my turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse takes this in silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, you been with a girl yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight? Why, I'm just getting ready to turn on the Younger charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been with a girl ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) Hell yeah! I been with... (sighs) Uh, not exactly. It's just, I don't want to get one of these paid ladies, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Frank and Cole, and even Bob, get all these girls because you're good looking and famous. You don't have to pay. They just look at me like I'm the baby brother. (then) Don't tell anyone, okay Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Tell you something else. (belches) I can't drink that good neither. I'm going to go outside and throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stumbles away and OUT THE DOOR. We hear him THROWING ENERGETICALLY a moment later. Jesse thinks for a moment, beckons over the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stumbles back in. A pretty young woman, LYLA, approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Are you Jim Younger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pulls himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't mind, Jesse James told me your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) Oh, you were talking to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but just so I could find out who you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I'm not being too forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just though you were awful cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Miss -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyla Devereux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, that's a pretty name. Buy you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we go upstairs and talk? It's so loud down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to stay smooth) Why don't we get a bottle of sherry to sip while we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so gentlemanly of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head to the bar, WE SEE Jesse slide some money to the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing) Devereux. My brother Cole dated a European girl once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about it much, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker is leading Rains into the room. Rains SNAPS SHUT h ever-present Pocketwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final route for the railroad is complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to seeing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of RAILROAD MEN wait around, wearing forced smile Parker shows Rains the map. REVEAL the wall-sized map of the United States. The plain marked RAIL LINE extends due west from New York, through Philadelphia, a straight shot west -- -- until it reaches Missouri, where it takes a painfully obvious swing in a large semi-circle south of the state, then swings up again and continues due west. Rains takes this in. Parker and the railroad men are tryi to look casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, viciously, Rains GRABS PARKER BY THE NECK and SLAMS his face against the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangled) Oh, that. I'll let Jenkins explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains drops Parker, who slides to the floor stunned. He turns to JENKINS, who is suddenly in an open area cleared the retreating railroad men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done a financial study of the construction costs projected into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cheaper to go around Jesse James, sir. Even with the detour and the extra track. It's just cheaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains turns to look at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire group looking at a serene Pinkerton staring at the James Gang tracking map, which is now festooned with markers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every three months, the James Gang circles back to the vicinity of Liberty, Missouri. They always pull a job right before they return, probably to have extra money to give family and friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English, Pinkerton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only four banks within that travel radius which they have not robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put men at all four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need. I have another tool at my disposal which will narrow it down to one bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Why, their intense hatred of you, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room holds its breath. Rains begins to smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A populous town with the fanciest SALOON we've seen yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on a sidewalk, Jesse stands alone at the edge of the building. He's holding an envelope. HIS POV reveals the address: "Miss Zerelda Mimms, Liberty Missouri."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SHOT
dialogues.text: as Jesse reaches up to the street lantern and lights the envelope on fire. He drops it to the ground and watches i smolder. Bob Younger walks up, holding a "Wanted" poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks, grins. The sketch is a dead ringer for Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things a fella has to do to get a little respect around here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a fine figure of a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Jesse, we've got a problem. (off his look) It's Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been full of vinegar lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's planning a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, he's my brother and I don't want to start trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in a semiprivate card room, Cole is talking to the rest of the Gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be the biggest score yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Frank step from the shadows. Cole tosses them a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyperion Bank, two day's ride from Liberty. They've got a hundred thousand dollars in railroad money just sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tosses the paper aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells funny, it being mentioned in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd read about it first, you'd have no problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've robbed just as many banks as you have! I know this town, and I know this bank, and I say it's an easy job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're forgetting who's in charge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming him) Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're in charge? We ain't partners any more, Jesse? You tell Cole Younger where and when to ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, he didn't mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taking sides against me, now, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So being with me is being against you? Well, we don't want to do that! None of us poor idiots want to go up against the famous Jesse James, greatest outlaw who ever lived!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse glares at Cole. The Gang is murmuring amongst themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the newspapers say. Weren't for Jesse James, this gang wouldn't be able to find a goat's ass with a stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clell Miller leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have got mighty full of yourself lately, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so. You all do? (to Frank) You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hesitates a half-second too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spitting) Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the one time one of us comes up with an idea --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got us through the War all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And almost got hanged in peacetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole LUNGES for Jesse, and in a flash they're streetfighting, all elbows and knees and rib punches, GRUNTING and SWEARING. Frank and Bob try to break it up, it's too fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them fight it out. The poison needs to leave the wound, to heal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse lands a ROUNDHOUSE, knocking Cole away. Cole goes f his gun, and in a blur they've both DRAWN and stand facin each other with cocked six-guns. The Gang watches in stun silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is healing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes a wound will kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (edging in) Boys, we don't want this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Jesse nor Cole will back down. They circle, still keeping their guns up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gritted teeth) I'm the better soldier, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm the better outlaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you both hate the railroad. That's what's important. We do this job, and Thaddeus Rains won't dare come West again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's gaze slides to Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that Rock Island bastard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his money.  He's putting up the payroll out of his own fortune. You do want to hurt Thaddeus Rains, don't you Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Cole stare at each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still smells fishy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let me run the show, General Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse thumbs down the hammer of his Colt. Cole does the same. The entire Gang breathes out as one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We hit this bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be smiling once you've got all that money to spend, cousin. (to Gang) Cole Younger's going to make everybody rich!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang CHEERS. Frank watches Jesse cross to the WINDOW and sag against it, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The James Gang rides up to the bank. A WATER TOWER can be seen behind the building opposite the bank. Jesse, Cole and Frank dismount and move swiftly to the ba doors. Comanche Tom, Jim Younger, Clell Miller and Loni Packwood dismount and take defensive positions. The few other Gang members stay on their horses, looking sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole holds up at the door, produces his shotgun. Frank an Jesse draw six guns. On Cole's lead, they KICK OPEN THE DOORS AND RUSH IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and the James brothers stride in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move! This is a robbery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dozen or so farmers and tellers raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loni is whistling away, rubbing his lucky rabbit's foot. squints up at the sun, turns, then stops. He slowly turns back... HIS POV reveals a dozen men APPEARING at the edge of the opposite rooftop, aiming rifles... Loni lets his rabbit's foot drop... The FIRST GUNSHOTS PLOW INTO LONI! As he falls back, we s the rabbit's foot hit the dusty ground... The Gang leaps for cover as a HAIL OF BULLETS begins to tear up the bank face around them. INT. HYPERION BANK Jesse, Frank and Cole whirl to face th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE'S POV in a mirror by the door reveals all twelve of the men in the bank drawing guns, shotguns, one rifle -- Jesse shoves Cole and Frank down. He KICKS a stool at the man with the rifle, dives right and ROLLS across a big oa desk. The men begin to FIRE. As BULLETS PING around him, Jesse FIRES from between his legs as he rolls across the desk. The assassins start to drop. Jesse completes his roll at a railing separating the manager's area from the bank floor. In one smooth move he up and RUNNING ALONG THE RAILING, defying gravity, drawin his shoulder Colts and shooting... The gunmen are crossing into each other's line of fire, Jesse's movement confusing them. Jesse's killed another five, only four left, but he's out of railing and -- CRASH! Through a teller's cage, disappearing behind the counter. The gunmen turn and BLAST the wooden counter, so screaming in panic.  CLICKS are heard as hammers fall on empty magazines. The gunmen stare at where Jesse disappeared, panting heavily. CLICK. They forgot about Cole and Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang is scrambling for cover. Loni's body lies in the street, his rabbit's foot lying in a pool of his blood. T Gang is returning fire, hiding behind water troughs, dead horses, barely staying alive. The ROAR OF GUNFIRE is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head for the end of the street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At both ends of the street, WAGONS ROLL into position, ea manned by two armed Pinkertons. The Gang is trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of the open, empty VAULT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole turns. Jesse is moving the surviving cowboys into th Vault. As the last one steps in, Jesse SLAMS the door closed. WE HEAR MORE GUNFIRE. Frank runs in from the back the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another dozen out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gonna rush us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just insurance in case we run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse crosses to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sticks his head out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside, you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire chews up the doorframe. Jesse pulls back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Cole are shooting through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all pinned down. Can't even get to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any ideas, little brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse thinks, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse comes CRASHING through a window! He rolls to a stop next to one of the horses, grabs a saddlebag, then -- to disbelief of the Gang -- he pivots and CRASHES right back into the Bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stumbles to his feet, yanks open the bag. Sticks of dynamite tumble out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN across the trapped Gang, still under fire, to the front of the next door Saloon, and then WE ZIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where wary patrons have taken cover from the gunfire. Suddenly -- BOOOM! One wall EXPLODES into dust! In the hole we see th interior of the Bank and -- Jesse James running through, already readying another sti of dynamite --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the Pinkerton gunmen are shooting at the Gang. Some of the gunmen look curiously as the windows to the buildi two doors down from the bank BLOW OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two Pinkerton detectives at the wagon barricade tu in shock as Jesse James LEAPS FROM THE SECOND FLOOR of a building he can't possibly be in, lands on the wagon, rol off and DASHES INTO a blacksmith shop across the street. They suddenly notice a HISS. They stand, look in the wago Jesse left a burning stick of dynamite in the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the wagon EXPLODING into matchsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blacksmith is gone, but there's a fire in the FORGE. Jesse leaps and KICKS OVER the forge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white-hot coals IGNITING everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pinkertons firing on the gang notice SMOKE rising fro below them. They look down ... REVEAL bellowing FLAMES and SMOKE enveloping the entire r of buildings below them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: The roof as a PINKERTON COMMANDER runs to ledge and looks at the rising flames himself. A HUGE EXPLOSION is heard O.C. A large SHADOW creeps over the snipers. They turn and look up -- -- at the Water Tower TOPPLING towards them! The Pinkertons dive out of the way as the tower SMASHES onto the roof, unleashing a TIDAL WAVE of water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UPSHOT of the sniper's ledge as the Pinkertons leap off, followed by a WALL OF WATER -- WIDEN to see the water POURING into the building from abo
Cowboys FLY out the windows, followed by TORRENTS of wate
One Pinkerton SWEPT UP and carried off the roof, BOUNCES off a second floor balcony and lands in a puddle on the d street below. FOLLOW the water rushing across the dirt street to the fe of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Tom and the Gang staring in disbelief at the total destruction Jesse has wrought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse rides out from a stable leading a team of horses. H reaches the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time to gawk, boys, we got somewhere else to be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Cole rush out from the bank. The Gang leaps ont the horses and put the spurs to them hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Gang galloping past the shattered wagon barricade, heading for the edge of town. Pinkerton riflemen run out of the bank and from behind th other barricade. One SHARPSHOOTER with a rifle drops to o knee, lines up... HIS POV shows Jesse in his sights. He tightens on the trigger, and just as he pulls -- -- Jim Younger rides into the line of fire! With a CRACK the bullet hits Jim square in the back. He slumps forward his horse. Comanche Tom leaps from his horse onto Jim's a urges it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The James Gang disappearing past the edge of town. The Pinkertons stand stunned amongst the ruin of their ambush Alan Pinkerton himself walks up, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang rides up onto a wooded hill where huge rocks jut from the earth. They all dismount, Jesse and Cole support Jim's limp form as they pull him from the saddle. Jim is drenched in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're gonna rest here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clell, Tom, go get Doc Mimms in Liberty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a long ride, Cole. We won't be back 'til morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you better get going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and Jesse are united again in their grief over Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, rip up some bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass me some whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's eyes flutter open for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... too young for whisky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time we'll make an exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, you explain to Lyla. My girl, you know, from that time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna tell her when you're resting up in bed with her, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, I'm sorry, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best time of my life. (weakly) I was famous, y'know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim dies. Cole cradles the body, begins rocking. Comanche Tom puts a hand on Bob's shoulder as Bob slumps against a rock. Jesse stands, walks away heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunset is heavy in the sky. Jesse stares off at it. His anguish is palpable. Frank comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda learned with Web. Made it look fun, made it look like an adventure. Got Web killed. Now Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim was old enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorts) He was a boy riding with the most famous outlaws in the West. How was he supposed to say no to that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Railroad burned him out too. You couldn't have stopped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a piss-poor liar for the smartest man I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A war against the railroad. What the hell were we thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it seemed like a good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse remembers the first time Frank said that. He crosse

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: the Gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Gang -- what's left of them -- waiting by the horses. The unspoken knowledge of whose fault this is hangs in th air. Cole is covered in Jim's blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make them pay for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?! We follow you for a year, and now that our blood's been spilled, you're gonna quit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's next? You? Me? Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole can't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't exactly go back to our lives, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not telling you what to do. You want to keep on following Cole, fine by me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods. He's leaving too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Ride on. But don't come back when you figure out you can't farm with a six-gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob embraces Frank. Jesse goes to shake hands with Cole, but the guilt and rage make his once-best friend unapproachable. Jesse smiles sadly and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee is letting a dog out. She looks up, freezes. Entrance she walks out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure appearing out of the early morning fog. It's Jesse, riding slow. He reins his horse in at the porch, dismounts. He stands staring at Zee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse. What are you thinking? There are bounty hunters and lawmen all over this county!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to see you. I'm getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee is shocked. Jesse looks serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the most wonderful woman in the world. Can't get her out of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... wonderful. It's just... I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful. Smart. And has the biggest... buck teeth in all of Missouri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Zee a second. Before she can process it all, Jes drops to one knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've quit my outlaw ways. Come live in my home and in my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee takes the hat off Jesse's head, tosses it into the ya and smiles. Jesse stands up and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victorian wooden houses with tin roofs and palm trees lin the street. Jesse and Zee ride in the back of the open carriage. They can't take their eyes off each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never have imagined us in a place like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I picked it. We can start a whole new life down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to be happy here, Mr. James? Without all that excitement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you. You keep me busy. I figure we'll get over to the hotel... get checked in, cleaned up... then I'd like to do something I've been thinking about for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute. There are certain things that have to wait until after the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse leans forward to the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver, change of plans. Take us to the nearest church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whichever one has God in it, that'll do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PASTOR sits at his desk while Jesse finishes filling ou a marriage license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is unusual. Most of our marriages are members of the congregation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think God'll mind, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse slides him two twenties with the license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord is remarkably tolerant of the charitable. (reading the license) "Jesse Woodson James." Jesse James? The Jesse James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have lied I suppose, but I want this marriage to be legal. I just want you to know, I'm trying to start a new life here. I'm depending on your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discretion? Sir, I am a man of the cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs to repair a leaky church roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinning, Jesse slides over another forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here in church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pastor pours. They drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELLS RING as Jesse and Zee walk out the front door a in arm.  The Pastor and his wife appear in the doorway, waving. Jesse and Zee hop in a waiting carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various townsfolk are lined up at the TELLER'S window. Cole, Bob, Comanche Tom, Clell and some NEW GANG MEMBERS BURST IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move! This is a robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's hands reach for the ceiling. Cole gestures to the Teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The safe. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! (pause) Uh, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Jesse James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is the Younger Gang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN speaks out timidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Youngers ride with Jesse James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ride. No more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd grumbles, plainly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN THE DAMN SAFE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. (muttering) Jesse James never yelled at folk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Comanche Tom exchange looks behind a fuming Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new Gang is spending its booty. Cole is putting a healthy dent in a bottle of rotgut. Bob is consoling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the best score yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still taking too long. The people used to snap to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was because of... the reputation the gang had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as people think Jesse's still riding, we will never get the respect we deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, we're outlaws. Not exactly the most respectable job, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Bob can't reach Cole now. He walks sadly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted Keys beach -- coconut palms and Australian pines. Clear water like glass stretching off forever. Jesse and Zee are having a picnic on the white sand. Both are in the latest in beach attire. He's in a one-piece th goes from his neck to his knees. Zee's in what is basical a dress with long pantaloons. Zee is reading. Jesse is stretched out on the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hmm" what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "But the life of the James Gang wasn't all robbing and shooting and killing, for these young Missouri bucks had a taste for the ladies... especially the handsome and charismatic Jesse James."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing him the cover) "Blazing Guns of the West. True Stories of Jesse James." Only a dime in the hotel lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not finished. (reading) "When he sauntered into a saloon, his spurs jangling and his pockets full of gold, the ladies flocked around him like flies to a candied apple." (looking at him) As I said. Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, sweetie, y'all wouldn't go believing one of them silly dime novels, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, have you ever noticed that when you're trying to charm your way out of trouble, your accent gets all farm boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, shucks, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. This is just sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swimming. Swimming is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse jumps up and OUT OF FRAME. A second later, he reach down and PULLS a chuckling Zee up out of the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse chases Zee out into the surf. They splash around until the water gets shoulder-deep, then both submerge. T reappear, locked in a kiss. CLOSE ON Zee's face as they break the kiss and embrace. She's in heaven. She opens he eyes, facing the beach. Something passes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the beach, where fifty Pinkerton detectives with rifles a lined up like a firing squad.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Zee's face. She squeezes Jesse tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't see it, it's not real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns around to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar figure walking along the sand. When the figure reaches the center of the line of detectives, he turns to the couple and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse James, you are under arrest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse takes one longing gaze at the open ocean. He heads for shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and the Gang are killing time. Bob runs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrested Jesse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the paper to the other Gang members, but walks straight to Cole. The two brothers stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd they --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't done --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT HAVE YOU DONE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob draws on Cole. Cole is shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob. I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear on Jimmy's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole hesitates. Bob thumbs back the hammer. Comanche Tom' hand closes over Bob's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob. You know Cole would never do such a thing. He and Jesse are best friends. They are cousins, blood brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob considers it, lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just upset about Jesse. We all are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks off. Comanche Tom speaks, but keeps his eyes on Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people know that when a brother kills a brother, a great curse comes down on that man, and when he dies he walks the desert as a dark spirit. I like Bob too much to let that happen. (looking at Cole) If I find out you turned in Jesse, I'll kill you myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comanche Tom moves off. Cole's thoughts are his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An establishing shot of the Florida fort being lashed by rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dank, black cell far in the bowels of Fort Jefferson. W HEAR CLANKING. WIDEN TO REVEAL Jesse doing push-ups. They come easily, despite Jesse being chained up like the Frankenstein mons The DOOR OPENS. Jesse looks up in mid-push-up. Alan Pinkerton is looking down at him. Jesse moves to the bed. Pinkerton, flanked by two guards, ENTERS. He sits on a stool provided by one of the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like the presidential suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's a similar room. But the hotel is in Washington D.C. You're not going to get a fair trial down here, in front of a jury of Jesse James sympathizers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll get a fair trial in front of a jury bought off by Thaddeus Rains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton produces two cigars, presenting one to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you order our houses burned down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that day. I am guilty of many things, but that was Mr. Thaddeus Rains and Parker, that day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse takes the cigar, and Pinkerton lights both. They pu for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping bad leg) Was this you, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse exposes his scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost ended my career before it began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you spot the ambush in Torrell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last February?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had all those cattle there, so I'd think the extra men were in town from the cattle drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cows had a brand from a farm just five miles out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost got me in Billings. I saw you there, shooting at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went myself to oversee the operation. Didn't help much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that one was close. A couple fellas quit after that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's nice to know. (then) We're going to hang you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have just killed Thaddeus Rains and been done with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I would have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hanged yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) You cocky little bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, you'll miss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll hang you. (then) But I may miss you just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jesse and Pinkerton smoke and discuss the past year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards are leading Jesse, who is in heavy arm irons, toward a prison car at the end of a waiting train. Pinkerton, Thaddeus Rains, and Parker walk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Parker. I remember you, too. You killed my Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker is set back by Jesse's voice. To cover his fear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not such a menace now, is he, Pinkerton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you feel that way, I could always take off the irons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains glares at Pinkerton, then turns back to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole thousands. You cost me tens of millions of dollars, months of lost construction. I wish I could hang you every single morning for a century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains checks his Pocketwatch, spots Jesse eyeing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that? Solid gold, my father had it made when he started this railroad. He gave it to me when I took over, I'll give it to my son when he runs this company, and he'll give it to his son -- The right type of men will always run this country, Jesse James, and little men like you will always suffer. You have stopped nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made you think twice about burning folks' homes down now, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse winks. With that Parker reaches back and SUCKER PUNCHES Jesse. Rains gloats as Jesse gets his breath back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll speak again in Washington, you insect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming on the same train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rains involuntarily looks behind Jesse. Jesse cranes his head and spots a CLUB CAR at the front of the train, seve cars away from his prison car. The other cars are packed with Pinkerton detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell you what. I'm going to have to pay you a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is a little shaken by the steel in Jesse's voice The guards DRAG JESSE OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards turn Jesse over to a BURLY DETECTIVE. Pinkerto enters just behind him. There are ten detectives in total the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burly Detective brings Jesse's arms above his head. H loops Jesse's chain over a rail that runs the length of t car. Two other detectives walk Jesse down the car, Jesse' hands suspended over his head. Jesse can just barely sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it. We can handle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ten seconds we have been in this car, I have seen you get close enough for Jesse James to grab your guns at least three times. And I assure you, if he gets his hands on one of your guns, you are all, and I mean all dead men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's chained up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put that on your tombstone. The guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grumbling, the detectives deposit their pistols in a box near the front of the car. Pinkerton walks out. The Burly Detective slides a Colt into his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, alone, surrounded by ten Pinkerton guards. The tra LURCHES, and they're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prison train highballs through the wooded, rolling hills. We see the engine, the coal car, a detective car, then the private salon car, two more cars of guards, and then the prison car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five guards are playing poker. Five others are standing along the length of the car. Jesse looks at the gun box waaay down the other end of the car. Things shift, and we (and Jesse) realize the train is goi downhill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fatty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burly Detective looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, ya barrel of pork lard. Here piggy piggy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detectives close on Jesse. Jesse stands as the Burly Detective moves right up on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you sayin' boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I saw you leavin' by the front door just as I was coming in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other detectives try to hide grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up now, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. You're wife said she needed some help, seeing as you were so fat you couldn't find your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burly Detectives BACKHANDS Jesse. Jesse spits blood and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she said you did that to her too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burly draws, points the gun right at Jesse's face. The other detectives GASP. Jesse stares down the barrel, then raises his eyes and speaks in a voice that is low and terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I could do this without the gun, but it just makes things easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM as Jesse KICKS Burly in the crotch! The gun FIRES, missing Jesse's head only because he jerks it like a mongoose. Jesse BACKHANDS the detective with the heavy chain! The g drops right into Jesse's hands -- The guards are running for the gun box -- Jesse flips the chain TIGHT, TUCKS UP and KICKS OFF from the back wall and SLIDES THE LENGTH OF THE RAIL over the detectives' heads! As he reaches the end he FIRES the gun blowing open the gun box. Jesse then SHOOTS the rail's ceiling strut, and then KICKS at the roof. The rail WRENCHES FREE, dropping Jesse to the floor. In a blur he's up, reaching into the gun box. He tosses one gu INTO THE AIR, then FANS THE HAMMER of another. Half the guards drop, but the other half are right on top of him and nobody's that fast -- Jesse drops the spent gun, CATCHES the other gun in the opposite hand and FANS THAT HAMMER all in a single breath As the smoke clears, the last of the detectives falls wit a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pops open the door to his car. He's improvised a gunbelt like his old one, holding six Colts. He's still holding the chain from his restraints. Now that they're n longer wrapped around Jesse, we see they're at least a fe yards long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some Pinkertons LOOK UP as a BANG sounds from on top of t car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jesse JUMPS OFF THE ROOF and -- CLANK as the chains -- fastened to the roof -- go taut an Jesse is at window level and he's FIRING AND FIRING into car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkertons falling, drawing their guns, not able to get a bead on Jesse because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is running along the side of the car, supported by the chain! Still shooting, he reaches the end, KICKS UP a is on the roof again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one Detective, barely alive, stumbling through the door, opening the door to the next

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detectives inside start as the wounded man falls into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks down and sees heavily armed Pinkertons coming out of the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's no turning back and he jumps to the top of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's running and the Pinkertons start SHOOTING THROUGH the roof. Jesse miraculously is untouched, almost to the CLUB CAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton is already moving as Parker and Thaddeus Rains look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vengeance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton bursts in. The men snap to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside! Get up on top! Go GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse JUMPS onto the club car, but pulls up short as detectives appear ahead of him. He turns to see other detectives climbing up behind him. He's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine EXPLODES! Sparks fly as the twisted engine GRINDS onto the tracks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The momentum carries everyone off their feet! Some detectives are torn from the train. Jesse slides across t roof of the Club Car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a smoking CANNON sitting on the tracks. WIDEN TO REVEAL Frank and Cole on horseback shading their eyes. Ze is daintily blowing out a fuse lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Now go get my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men start to gallop toward the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, Pinkerton, and the detectives look down the track and see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Cole riding toward them. From the woods ride Comanche Tom and Bob Younger, folding into perfect formation. The four THUNDER toward the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton rushes back in. Parker and Rains are looking ou the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only four of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move you fools!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the two businessmen and heads them to the rear o the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank draws a gun and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO DOZEN RIDERS pour out of the woods, all firing at the Pinkerton! The Pinkertons return fire, taking shelter in train cars as the riders strafe the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse swings over the edge of the train, looks through th window. Rains is gone. He turns and starts running back along the top of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton, Rains and Parker tumble out of the door and ru for the woods. Jesse LEAPS DOWN from the top of the train onto Pinkerton They wrestle, separate. Pinkerton stands, reaching for hi gunbelt. Empty. With almost a resigned sigh, he looks up. Jesse's pointin the gun at Pinkerton's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton, stunned to realize he's still alive. He turns see Parker, fall to the ground, his own gun half-drawn, Jesse turns the gun on Rains.
